title: Venezuela two weeks after Maduro's abduction: 'I was scared, then I cried with joy. Now, I'm scared again'
subhed: Following the abduction of Nicolas Maduro, who has led Venezuela since 2013, Le Monde collected accounts from residents of Caracas and its suburbs.

title: Behind Iran's brutal crackdown, rulers play for survival
byline: By Ghazal Golshiri and Madjid Zerrouky

title: Trump threatens tariffs as US lawmakers back Denmark, Greenland
Cold case unit looking into French rapist Dominique Pelicot
subhed: Dominique Pelicot, who was convicted or organizing the mass rape of his then-wife Gisèle Pelicot, is being investigated for additional crimes: a rape and a murder in 1991, and an attempted rape in 1999.

title: French authorities seize nearly €1 billion from Russian oligarchs since the start of war in Ukraine
subhed: Villas, financial assets, jewelry:  Investigations carried out in France, notably by the Paris prosecutor's office, have led over the past four years to the seizure of record amounts of assets belonging to Russian political and business figures suspected of money laundering or tax fraud.

title: 'That 'Stranger Things' brings Prince or David Bowie back to life is both wonderful and dreadful'
subhed: In the final episode of the hit Netflix series, 15- to 25-year-olds discovered 'Purple Rain' and 'Heroes,' whose streams have soared across music platforms. Unfortunately, the younger generation has limited itself to these snippets, showing little interest in the artists or their discographies, writes Michel Guerrin, editor-in-chief of Le Monde, in his column.

title: Golshifteh Farahani, Iranian actress: 'Resisting horror, dictatorships and invaders is in our blood'
subhed: In an op-ed for Le Monde, the exiled actress, an icon of Iranian women's fight for freedom, responds for the first time to the ongoing massacres in Iran.

title: French court's 'cold case' ruling casts doubt on other investigations
How a uranium supply coveted by Russia ended up in limbo in Niger
US air authority warns of 'military activities' over Mexico, Central America
Yann Le Cun: 'Why I'm leaving Meta to launch my own AI start-up'
byline: By David Larousserie and Alexandre Piquard

title: In Greenland, a European military mission of uncertain contours seeks to counter Trump
byline: By Elsa Conesa (Berlin (Germany) correspondent), Philippe Jacqué (Brussels, Europe bureau), Virginie Malingre (Brussels, Europe bureau), Isabelle Mandraud (Nuuk (Greenland), special correspondent) and Elise Vincent

title: 'The budget and the Mercosur deal: Two symptoms of France's political powerlessness'
Putin holds calls with Iran and Israel, offers mediation amid unrest
French PM edges toward forcing budget through Parliament
Macron issues stern warning to French defense industry
Germany questions future of the European project
How Gianni Infantino's pay quadrupled in 10 years as head of FIFA
The twists and turns of Trump's military strategy
byline: By Chloé Hoorman and Elise Vincent

title: Benedictine nuns of Montmartre spent 40 years 'under duress,' report finds
subhed: An independent investigation, commissioned by the congregation of the iconic Paris neighborhood, reported that former prioress general Mother Marie-Agnès ruled through an atmosphere of 'terror and suspicion' up to her death in 2016. The control of food and body weight of the congregation's members was central to the superior's domination.

title: Istanbul's ultra-violent gangs tighten their grip on the city
subhed: In Turkey's major cities, criminal gangs made up of teenagers and young adults have grown rapidly in recent years, fueled by a boom in synthetic drug trafficking.

title: 'India and Europe are discovering new geostrategic affinities, an example of realignment amid global chaos'
subhed: The warming of relations between Europe and the world's most populous country reflects a counter-strategy to the hostility of the Trump administration, writes Le Monde's columnist Sylvie Kauffmann.

title: Regulating social media is key to protecting young people's health
